flawed_nl_solution:
James earns 20*0.2=$20*0.2=4>>4 less while working his second job
So he earns 20-4=$20-4=16>>16 an hour
At his first job he earns 20*30=$20*30=600>>600
He works 30/2=<<30/2=15>>15 hours at his second job
So he earns 15*16=$15*16=420>>420
So he earns 600+420=$600+420=1020>>1020 a week

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 240.0, not 420.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
